intro: Hesperomeles oblonga, commonly known as the oblonga huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Andes mountains of South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Hesperomeles oblonga is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor.
